column3: str
Can I help you?
What will you ask?
What do you do here?
What kind of place is this?
Nothing.
I was stationed here shortly after the castellum was liberated from the Garleans.
Although I was later assigned to the Velodyna Gatekeepers, my role remains much the same.
This was simply called Velodyna bridge before the Garleans arrived. They saw fit to transform it into a base for their supply trains.
Following their departure, it was left to fall into disrepair. That was until Captain Alpa suggested putting it to good use.
We Gatekeepers are dedicated to our work, but unfortunately we are rather lacking in numbers. Eshana is always looking to hire adventurers, if you're interested.
The griffin statues are truly remarkable. I heard that Alpa had a gift for metalwork, but I had no idea she was so artistic.
Those guest rooms have made a world of difference. I'd much rather travelers slept here than become a midnight feast for some ghastly creature.
Now that we have an infirmary, sickly and hobbled travelers can receive proper treatment before they continue on their way.
Naturally, we Gatekeepers are also glad to have experienced chirurgeons on hand.
When I heard we were taking in Qalyana deserters, I was extremely apprehensive. And now they're sleeping under the same roof as the Vira!

If I were sharing quarters with a former enemy, I would be afraid of waking up with a dagger between my ribs. It seems Captain Alpa and her Vira friends are considerably more trusting than I am, though.
The castellum has certainly changed since the Gatekeepers arrived. Who could have guessed this former Garlean stronghold would become such a lively hub of activity?
This was simply called Velodyna bridge before the Garleans arrived. They saw fit to transform it into a base for their supply trains.
What's more, atop this tower they could survey the area for malms around. Their ambition knows no bounds, nor does their villainy.
